API¶

Boards¶

Board¶

class miniworldmaker.boards.board.Board(columns: int = 40, rows: int = 40)[Quellcode]¶

Base class for creating boards

__init__(columns: int = 40, rows: int = 40)[Quellcode]¶

initializes a new GameGrid :param columns: The number of columns :param rows: The number of rows

act()[Quellcode]¶

Überschreibe diese Methode in deinen Kind-Klassen

actors¶

return – A list of all actors

add_actor(actor: miniworldmaker.actors.actor.Actor, position: tuple) → miniworldmaker.actors.actor.Actor[Quellcode]¶

adds actor to grid :param actor: the actor as subclass of Actor :param position: the position in the grid :return: The Actor

add_image(path: str) → pygame.Surface[Quellcode]¶
Parameter: img_path – The path to the image
Rückgabe: The image
class_name¶

return – The Class Name of Actor

columns¶

return – number of columns of the grid

frame¶

Returns the actual frame :return: the value of actual frame

get_actors_by_pixel(pixel: tuple) → list[Quellcode]¶

Returns all players who have a certain pixel in common :param pixel: The pixel-coordinates :return: All actors as list

get_actors_in_area(value: Union[pygame.Rect, tuple], actor_type=None) → list[Quellcode]¶

Gets all actors at location :param value: Either a tuple with cordinates in the grid or a Rect :param actor_type: Filters actor by type (e.g. all <Player>-Objects at position) :return:

get_event(event, data)[Quellcode]¶

Returns events triggered by events. :param event: The event :param data: The data of the event

height¶

return – Returns the height of the grid

pixel_to_grid_position(position: tuple) → tuple[Quellcode]¶

Returns the position in the grid by pixel pixel coordcinates :param position: (x, y), pixel coordinates :return: (x,y) position in grid

rect_to_position(position: tuple, rect: pygame.Rect) → pygame.Rect[Quellcode]¶

Centers a rectangle above a tile :param position: (x, y): Position of rectangle :param rect: the rectangle :return: centered rectangle

remove_actors_from_location(location: Union[tuple, pygame.Rect], actor_type=None)[Quellcode]¶

Removes actor from an area or position :param location: The location can be either a Rect or a tuple with grid coordinates :param actor_type: Filters actor by type (e.g. all <Player>-Objects at position)

remove_all_actors()[Quellcode]¶

Entfernt alle Akteure aus dem Grid.

rows¶

return – number of rows of the grid

set_size(tile_size: int = 1, columns: int = 40, rows: int = 40, margin: int = 0)[Quellcode]¶

Sets size of a gamegrid :param tile_size: The tile_size in pixels :param columns: The number of columns :param rows: The number of rows :param margin: the margin between tiles

show()[Quellcode]¶

Starts the program

stop()[Quellcode]¶

Stoppt die Ausführung (siehe auch run)

tile_margin¶

return – The margin between tiles

tile_size¶

return – The Tile size in pixels

tile_to_rect(position: tuple) → pygame.Rect[Quellcode]¶

Returns the enclosing rectangle. :param position: (x, y), grid coordinates :return: the enclosing rectangle

width¶

return – Returns the width of the grid

window¶

return – returns the parent windows

TiledBoard¶

class miniworldmaker.boards.tiled_board.TiledBoard(columns=20, rows=16, tile_size=20, tile_margin=0)[Quellcode]¶
add_actor(actor: miniworldmaker.actors.actor.Actor, position: tuple = None) → miniworldmaker.actors.actor.Actor[Quellcode]¶

adds actor to grid :param actor: the actor as subclass of Actor :param position: the position in the grid :return: The Actor

get_actors_in_area(value: Union[pygame.Rect, tuple], actor_type=None) → list[Quellcode]¶

Gets all actors at location :param value: Either a tuple with cordinates in the grid or a Rect :param actor_type: Filters actor by type (e.g. all <Player>-Objects at position) :return:

static get_neighbour_cells(position: tuple) → list[Quellcode]¶

Gets a list with all neighbour cells :param position: The position of the cell :return: the neighbour cells as list

is_empty_cell(position: tuple) → bool[Quellcode]¶

Checks if cell is empty :param position: the position of the cell :return: True if cell is empty

remove_actors_in_area(value: Union[pygame.Rect, tuple], actor_type=None) → list[Quellcode]¶

Removes all actors in an area :param value: Either rectangle or grid-position :param actor_type: The actor type which should be removed

Returns: true if any actor was removed

show_grid()[Quellcode]¶

Draws the grid on the background
